section.tickets.title: How do I get tickets for the ESC 2026 in Austria?
section.tickets.text: Ticket sales for the ESC 2026 are expected to start at the beginning of 2026 – as soon as the venue has been officially confirmed. Official tickets will only be available through authorized platforms such as oeticket.com. Beware of scam sites!
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions about the Eurovision Song Contest
faq.a1: The Eurovision Song Contest 2026 will take place in Vienna: The semi-finals are on May 12 and May 14, and the grand finale on May 16, 2026.
faq.a2: ESC 2026 will be held in Vienna at the Wiener Stadthalle. The decision was made in August 2025 in favor of the Austrian capital.
faq.a3: Tickets are sold exclusively through authorized platforms like oeticket.com. Beware of unofficial vendors.
faq.a4: This has not yet been determined. ORF will present the Austrian act at a later stage.
faq.q5: Will ESC 2026 be broadcast on TV?
faq.a5: Yes, ORF and other European broadcasters will broadcast the competition live as usual.

impressum.notice: This website is a privately operated fan site and is not connected to the EBU or the official organizers of the Eurovision Song Contest. All content was created independently and does not use any copyrighted material.
summary:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2026 will take place in Vienna in May! After the impressive victory of JJ with his song "Wasted Love" at ESC 2025 in Basel, Austria will be the host for the third time – after the editions of 1967 and 2015.

After a multi-stage application process, ORF officially selected Vienna as the host city on August 20, 2025. The venue will be the Wiener Stadthalle, which already hosted ESC in 2015.

The dates are set: The first semi-final will take place on May 12, 2026, the second semi-final on May 14, 2026. The grand final will be celebrated on Saturday, May 16, 2026.

Several cities had previously expressed interest – including Graz, Innsbruck, Wels, Linz, Oberwart, and St. Pölten – but in the end, Vienna prevailed with its infrastructure, international accessibility, and many years of experience.

So it's clear: ESC 2026 will thrill music fans from all over Europe with two exciting semi-finals and a grand final in the Wiener Stadthalle.

Look forward to an unforgettable show in the Wiener Stadthalle – it will be a real highlight!
section.news.title: News about Eurovision Song Contest 2026
history.title: Looking Back: The Last 10 Eurovision Winners
news.2025-08-20: Vienna has been confirmed as the host city for the Eurovision Song Contest 2026, with the final show on May 16, 2026, at the Wiener Stadthalle.
news.2025-05-26: Vienna expands its concept with an additional open-air fan mile along the Danube Canal and promises an accessible ESC experience.
news.2025-05-25: The ORF delegation announces a decision on the host city for July 2025. All remaining applicants are currently being intensively reviewed.
news.2025-05-24: Innsbruck relies on a hybrid event model with digital interaction and live events at the Olympiaworld complex.
news.2025-05-23: Graz presents details of its ESC 2026 concept and plans an indoor stage at the Stadthalle as well as a Europe-wide public viewing network.
news.2025-05-22: The city of Vienna presents an initial concept for the ESC 2026, which includes a stage at the Rathausplatz and a comprehensive sustainability concept.
news.2025-05-21: The city of Wels unexpectedly withdraws its application, citing logistical challenges as the reason.
news.2025-05-20: The city of Salzburg officially withdraws from the race to host the Eurovision Song Contest 2026. Graz and Innsbruck reconfirm their applications.
news.2025-05-19: JJ, the winner of the Eurovision Song Contest 2025, expresses his support for Vienna as the host city for the Eurovision Song Contest 2026.
news.2025-05-18: Financial challenges at ORF: The costs for hosting the Eurovision Song Contest 2026 are estimated to be over 30 million Euros.
news.2025-05-17: ORF announces a transparent selection of the host city for the Eurovision Song Contest 2026. Vienna, Graz, Innsbruck, Wels, and Oberwart show interest.
news.2025-05-16: Following JJ's victory with 'Wasted Love' at the Eurovision Song Contest 2025 in Basel, Austria begins preparations for the Eurovision Song Contest 2026.
